SEARCH

Class gameplayController

java.lang.Object
gameplayController
public class gameplayController extends Object
The controller class for the gameplay screen. GameplayController manages the functionality of the gameplay screen, it initializes the game, update game state, handle user input
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.4
Author:
Waleed Aamer

    • gameplayController

      public gameplayController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the gameplay screen.

    • updateGameState

      public void updateGameState(int seconds, int minutes, int points, int level, int finalAccuracy, String difficulty, String topic)
      Updates the game state with new values.
      Parameters:
      seconds - the seconds passed in the game
      minutes - the minutes passed in the game
      points - the current points of the player
      level - the current level of the player
      finalAccuracy - the final accuracy of the player's guesses
      difficulty - the selected difficulty level
      topic - the selected topic of study

    • clickPauseButton

      public void clickPauseButton()
      Handles the click event of the pause button.

      Pauses the timer then it loads the pause screen from the corresponding FXML file

    • exitGame

      public void exitGame()
      Exits the game and closes the app.

      This method closes the application window by retreiving the stage, and then calling the close() method on the stage.

    • loadMainMenu

      public void loadMainMenu()
      Loads the main menu scene.

      This method initializes the main menu scene by loading the "mainMenu.fxml" file using FXMLLoader. It resets the game level and timer and sets the loaded screen as the scene of the window currently being displayed.

      Since:
      1.4

    • gameButtonPress

      public void gameButtonPress(ActionEvent event) throws MultimediaException
      Handles the event that the user presses a button during the game.

      This method plays a sound and toggles the colour of a button when it is pressed between selected and unselected states. It updates the input word based on the clicked button's text.

      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent representing the button press event
      Throws:
      MultimediaException - if there is an issue with multimedia the playback

    • handleHintButton

      public void handleHintButton() throws MultimediaException
      Handles the hint button functionality in the game.

      This method displays hints in the SpeechBubble based on the learning topic. It reveals a letter in the word if the game difficulty is not set to "Junior" and the user needs a hint.

      Throws:
      MultimediaException - if there is an issue with multimedia playback

    • handleCheckButton

      public void handleCheckButton() throws MultimediaException
      Handles the action when the Check button is clicked. The check button checks if the word entered by the user is correct. When correct guess is made, the points are updated and there is a message outputted to the user. When an incorrect guess is made, the number of incorrect answers increases by 1 and output message to user.
      Throws:
      MultimediaException - if there is an issue with multimedia playback

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel() throws MultimediaException
      Goes to the next level of the game. If the current level is 2 or less, increment the level and reinitialize the game. If the current level is greater or equal to 3, stops the timer, plays a congratulatory sound, displays a message indicating the completion of all levels, and changes the icon.
      Throws:
      MultimediaException - if there is an issue with multimedia playback

    • getGameState

      public GameState getGameState()
      Retrieves the current game state.
      Returns:
      the current game state
